alert.note: Alert for Burnet; Kinney; Llano; Medina; Uvalde; Val Verde (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued June 18 at 1:59PM CDT until June 20 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT MONDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM MONDAY TO 9 PM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Heat Advisory, heat index values up to 110. For the Excessive Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 115 expected. * WHERE...Llano, Burnet, Val Verde, Kinney, Uvalde and Medina Counties. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, until 1 PM CDT Monday. For the Excessive Heat Warning, from 1 PM Monday to 9 PM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high heat indices may cause heat illnesses to occur.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Burnet; Kinney; Llano; Medina; Uvalde; Val Verde
